column17: The grenade was thrown at a retail area in Bitola, Bitola Macedonia.
column18: 12/04/2008: On Thursday morning, assailants threw one grenade in a retail area in Bitola, Bitola, Macedonia. The attack damaged several shops. There were no reports of casualties and no group claimed responsibility.
column39: The grenade attack targeted a retail area in Bitola, Macedonia.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: A grenade was used in the attack.
column127: \"\"Several Shops Damaged in Grenade Attack in Bitola"

column17: The attack took place in Ohrid, Macedonia.
column18: 03/02/2009: On Monday, in Ohrid, Macedonia, three Greek tour buses were attacked by 30 Macedonian nationalists, who threw sticks and stones at the tourists, along with spray-painting various anti-Greek slogans on the coaches. One tourist was injured, and the buses were damaged and spray painted. No group claimed responsibility.
column47: Two coach buses in which the tourists were located were targeted.
column64: The specific motive for the attack was the nationalists' opposition to the name of their country.
column97: The nationalists threw sticks and stones at the tourists. They also used spray-paint to damage the coaches.
column108: The coach buses suffered minor spray-paint damage.
column125: The available sources the injuries for this attack from zero to two, and because no majority figures were reported, the lowest proferred casualty figures were used in order to preserve statistical accuracy in the database. The available sources listed the number of coaches for this attack from three to five, and because no majority figures were reported, the lowest proferred casualty figures were used in order to preserve statistical accuracy in the database.

column183: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources speculated that the attack may have been in revenge for the recent murder of two ethnic Albanian youths by a Macedonian police officer in the town of Gostivar.  Sources also speculated that the attack may be part of a larger trend of sectarian violence between Macedonia's ethnic Albanian minority and Macedonian majority.

column18: 02/16/2014: A grenade detonated near a group of Roma children in Tetovo city, Polog region, Macedonia. At least five children were injured as a result of the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
column97: A hand grenade was thrown in the attack.

column17: The incident took place in the Karpos area.
column18: 02/23/2014: An explosive device was thrown near the office of the Social Democratic Alliance of Macedonia (SDSM) in Karpos district, Skopje city, Skopje region, Macedonia. No one was injured in the blast; however, the building and five nearby vehicles were damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column108: An office building and five vehicles were damaged in this attack.
